event.title: 1869 a small number of settlers had established

data.event: Prior to 1869 a small number of settlers had established farms around Diver Lake, Long Lake and Brannen Lake.
In 1869 Robert Dunsmuir discovered a thin surface seam coal on the roots of a fallen tree while visiting Diver Lake.
By 1871 Dunsmuir had discovered the Wellington coal seam which underlaid his initial discovery.

event.title: covered most of what is today

data.event: This first grant covered most of what is today known as the Wellington Land District.

event.title: grew up along the crest of land which is now

data.event: Initially the town grew up along the crest of land which is now Jingle Pot Road.
